summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of a witness, referred to as [REDACTED], conducted on April 24, 2019, pursuant to a proffer agreement. The witness details her recruitment as a 14-year-old by a friend to perform sexualized massages for Jeffrey Epstein, her subsequent role in recruiting other underage girls for him, and the progression of abuse. She describes Epstein's preferences, payment methods, interactions with his staff, and her eventual cessation of contact after an FBI visit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the interview. The witness describes performing sexualized massages for him starting when she was 14, his preferences for young girls, his instructions, and his payment of cash.

persons.name: Alexandra Conlon
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present for the FBI interview.

persons.name: Alexandra Elonowitz-Hess
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present for the FBI interview.

persons.name: Jenna Dabbs
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present for the FBI interview.

persons.name: Leslie Groff
persons.context: Identified as Epstein's secretary. The witness describes calling her to schedule massage appointments and to inform her when she had a new girl for Epstein.

persons.name: Tracey Lnu
persons.context: Mentioned as a woman who possibly answered the phone at Epstein's office.

connections.description: Epstein paid the witness for sexualized massages starting when she was 14. He progressed to more intimate touching and used a vibrator on her. He also tasked her with recruiting other underage girls.
The friend recruited the witness into Epstein's scheme, sold her the 'business' of providing girls to Epstein, and they later worked as a team to recruit other girls.
The friend was also a victim who massaged Epstein and acted as a recruiter, bringing the witness and other girls to him.
Groff is identified as Epstein's secretary who managed his schedule and coordinated appointments for massages with the witness and other girls.
The witness regularly called Groff to schedule her own appointments with Epstein and to inform her when she had recruited a new girl for him.

events.title: Witness's Initial Recruitment and Abuse by Epstein
events.description: At age 14, the witness was recruited by a friend to give Epstein a massage. The routine involved her being topless, touching Epstein's nipples, and him masturbating. She was paid $300.

events.title: Witness Recruits Other Underage Girls for Epstein
events.description: Epstein instructed the witness to recruit other girls, specifying they should be under 18. She recruited an estimated 20-50 girls, aged 13-17, from nightclubs and her social circle.

events.title: Group Incident in Epstein's Bedroom
events.description: On one occasion, Epstein took the witness and two other girls ([REDACTED] and [REDACTED]) to his bedroom where they all laid on the bed. The witness was naked and recalled being touched by Epstein.

events.title: FBI Agents Visit Witness's Home
events.description: When the witness was 17-19, two FBI agents came to her home looking for her. Her boyfriend (now husband) answered the door.

events.title: Epstein Cuts Contact After FBI Visit
events.description: After the witness informed Epstein about the FBI visit, he told her not to call him anymore, said they couldn't talk on the phone, and promised to set her up with a lawyer.

events.title: FBI Proffer Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness was interviewed by the FBI under a proffer agreement, with her attorneys and AUSAs present. She provided detailed information about her experiences with Epstein.

locations: 3rd Avenue (location of Epstein's office where witness picked up money)
keyFacts: The witness was 14 years old when she was first brought to Epstein for a sexualized massage, during which Epstein asked her age.
Epstein explicitly instructed the witness to recruit girls for him and said, "Don't bring me anyone over 18."
The witness estimates she brought between 20 to 50 girls, aged 13-17, to Epstein over several years.
Epstein's secretary, Leslie Groff, coordinated the massage appointments and would ask the witness, "Do you have anyone new?"
After FBI agents visited the witness's home, Epstein told her to stop calling him and said he would provide her with a lawyer.
